projects.name: Q-Learning w/ Atari Breakout
projects.description: Trained a neural network to play OpenAI Gym's Atari Breakout game environment using TensorFlow. After setting the learning-rate and epsilon-probability and running the simulation for 30 episodes (2~ weeks in a VM), the agent started averaging a reward of 145.17. Essentially making it better at the game than me.

projects.name: NavMesh Tutorial
projects.description: Created by following the steps of Brackey's NavMesh Tutorial. Features an agent that automatically avoids obstacles (both static and dynamic) in a 3D space using Unity's inbuilt NavMesh components. By clicking at locations on the map, the agent calculates the best unobstructed path and moves there.

projects.name: TensorFlow Image Classifier
projects.description: Inspired by the TensorFlow for Poets Codelab by Google Developers. Trained the neural network using the Inception V3 Architecture on a repository of rabbit images. By manipulating training parameters, the model achieved an accuracy of up to 99% in distinguishing between four rabbit breeds as well as pictures of unknown objects.

projects.name: Unity 3D Platformer
projects.description: A simple 3D environment which emulates 2D platforming. The player controls a ball to collect coins scattered throughout the level. Allowed me to experiment with character controllers, physics, lighting, texturing, and sound effects.

projects.name: Unity 2D Platformer
projects.description: A purely 2D platforming environment. WIP as I expand its features into a fully-fledged video game. Currently uses placeholder assets from Unity Asset Store and existing video games. Implemented sprite animation, background parallaxing, respawning, and shooting.

projects.name: MEVN Real-Time Chat
projects.description: Real-time cross-browser chat application. Tested by logging in from two separate browser instances and chatting between them. Single-page application leveraging the MEVN stack and Socket.io.

projects.name: Universal Finance Manager
projects.description: Android application that provides comprehensive tracking and budgeting of personal finance. Stores user data in a local Room database and utilizes Dagger dependency injection. Made in an Agile/Scrum development cycle. In a 5-man dev team, I was the scrum master and a developer.

projects.name: Accountabillibuddy
projects.description: Desktop application that predicts the profitability of stock market investments. Stock market data is fetched from the Yahoo! Finance API via a third-party API. User data is stored in a PostgreSQL database hosted on AWS's Relational Database Service. My roles were full-stack development, technical writing, and graphic design.

projects.name: Swing Breakout Game
projects.description: Break-Out style video game with a twist! This time there's two projectiles, each with their own physics, balanced on a swing. Letting either projectile fall decrements the lives counter. This was made to practice OOP and test the limits of Java's Swing library.

projects.name: Tsarbucks
projects.description: A fictional coffee shop's web application. Log in as a customer and place orders by adding menu items into your shopping cart. Employees can log in and fulfill said orders. Implemented using a PHP and locally hosted MySQL database via XAMPP and phpMyAdmin.

projects.name: Online Portfolio
projects.description: This website! Created for personal use and to perfect my abilities in classical front-end design (HTML/CSS/JS). All content is rendered to the view from external JSON data, allowing for easier updates & maintenance. Completely accordant with W3C's HTML5 and CSS3 standard, as well as a 90+/100 PageSpeed score.

Do Pandas eat bananas? Check out this short video that shows that yes! pandas do seem to really enjoy bananas!
